list.item: is ſaid of plaine right-angled Triangles.
list.label: Planotriangular,
list.item: is ſaid of plaine Triangles, that is, ſuch as are not Sphericall.
list.label: Pleuſeotechnie,
list.item: the Art of Navigation, of 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , navigatio, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , ars.
list.label: Pluſminuſed,
list.item: is ſaid of Moods which admit of Menſurators or whoſe illatitious termes are never the ſame, but either more or leſſe then the maine quaehtas.
list.label: Poliechyrologie,
list.item: the Art of fortifying Townes and Cities, of 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , urbs, civit as 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , munio firmo, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , ratio.
list.label: Poſſubſervient,
list.item: is that which after another ſerveth for the reſolving of a queſtion; of poſt, and ſubſerviens: of ſub and ſervio.
list.label: Potentia,
list.item: is that wherein the force and whole reſult of another thing lies.
list.label: Power,
list.item: is the ſquare, quadrat, or product of a line extended upon it ſelfe, or of a number in it ſelfe multiplied.
list.label: Powered,
list.item: ſquared quadrified.
list.label: Precept,
list.item: document, from praecipio, praeceptum.
list.label: Praeroſcenda,
list.item: are the termes, which muſt be knowne before we can attaine to the knowledge of the maine quaeſitas of prae and noſco.
list.label: Praenoſcendall,
list.item: is ſaid of the Concordances of thoſe Moods, which agree in the ſame praenoſcendas.
list.label: Praeſection,
list.item: praeſectionall, is concerning the digit towards the left, whoſe cutting off ſaveth the labour of ſubtracting the double or ſingle Radius.
list.label: Praeſcinded problems,
list.item: are thoſe ſpeculative Datoquaeres, which are not applied to any matter by way of practice.
list.label: Praeſubſervient,
list.item:
is ſaid of thoſe Moods which in the firſt place we muſt make uſe of for the explanation of others; of prae, and
• ub • ervio.
list.label: Prime,
list.item: is ſaid of the furtheſt Cathetoppoſite, or Angle at the Baſe, contained within the Triangle to be reſolved.
list.label: Primifie the Radius,
list.item: is to put the Radius in the firſt place, primumque inter terminos collocare proportionales.
list.label: Problem, problemet,
list.item: a queſtion or datoquaere, from 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , unde 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 propoſitum, objectaculum.
list.label: Product,
list.item: is the reſult, factus, or operatum of a multiplication, from produco, productum.
list.label: Proportion,
list.item: proportionality, are the ſame as Analogy, and Analogiſme; the firſt being a likeneſſe of termes, the other of proportions.
list.label: Propoſition,
list.item: a propoſed ſentence, whether theorem or problem.
list.label: Proſiliencie,
list.item: is a demiſſion, or falling of the Perpendicular, from proſilio, ex pro & ſalio.
list.label: Proturgetick,
list.item: is ſaid of the firſt operation of every Diſergetick Mood, of 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , the 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 being Attically contracted into 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 .

list.head: Q.
list.label: QUadrant,
list.item: the fourth part of a Circle.
list.label: Quadranting,
list.item: the protracting of a Sphericall ſide unto a Quadrant.
list.label: Quadrat,
list.item: a Square, a forma quadrae, the power or poſſibility of a line, vide, Power.
list.label: Quadrobiquadraequation,
list.item: concerneth the Square of the ſubtendent ſide, which is equall to the Biquadrat, or two Squares of the Ambients.
list.label: Quadroſubduction,
list.item: is concerning the ſubtracting of the Square of one of the Ambients from the Square of the Subtendent.
list.label: Quaeſitas,
list.item: the things demanded from quaero▪ quaeſitum.
list.label: Quotient,
list.item: is the reſult of a diviſion, from quoties, how many times.

list.head: R.
list.label: RAdically meeting,
list.item: is ſaid of thoſe Oblongs, or Squares, whoſe ſides doe meet together.
list.label: Radius,
list.item: ray, or beame is the Semidiameter, called ſo metaphorically, from the ſpoake of a wheele which is to the limb thereof, as the Semidiameter, to the circumference of a circle.
list.label: Reciprocall,
list.item:
is ſaid of proportionalities, or two rowes of proportionals, wherein the firſt of the firſt is to the firſt of the ſecond, as the laſt of
the ſecond is to the laſt of the firſt, and contrarily.
list.label: Rectangular,
list.item: is ſaid of thoſe figures, which have right Angles.
list.label: Refinedly,
list.item: is ſaid when we go the ſhorteſt way to work by primifying the Radius.
list.label: Renvoy,
list.item: a remitting from one place to another, it comes from the French word Renvoyer.
list.label: Repreſentative,
list.item: is ſaid of the letters, which ſtand for whole words; as E. for ſide, L. for ſecant, U. for ſubtendent.
list.label: Reſiduat,
list.item: is to leave a remainder, nempe id quod reſidet & ſupereſt.
list.label: Reſolver,
list.item: is that which looſeth and untieth the knot of a difficulty, of re and ſolvo.
list.label: Reſolutory,
list.item: is ſaid of the laſt partition of the Loxogonoſphericall operations.
list.label: Reſult,
list.item: is the laſt effect of a work.
list.label: Root,
list.item: is the ſide of a Square, Cube, or any coſſick figure.

list.head: S.
list.label: SCheme,
list.item: ſignifieth here the delineation of a Geometricall figure, with all parts neceſſary for the illuſtrating of a demonſtration, from 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , habeo.
list.label: Sciography,
list.item: the Art of ſhadowing, of 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , umbra, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , ſcribo.
list.label: Segment,
list.item: the portion of a thing cut off, quaſi ſecamentum, quod a re aliqua ſecatur.
list.label: Sexageſimat,
list.item: ſubſexageſimat, reſubſexageſimat, and bireſubſexageſimat, are ſaid of the diviſion, ſubdiviſion, reſubdiviſion, and reer-reſubdiviſion of degrees into minuts, ſeconds, thirds, and fourths, in 60. of each other: the deviſor of the fore goer being ſucceſsively the following dividend, and the quotient alwayes ſixty.
list.label: Sharp,
list.item: is ſaid of acute Angles.
list.label: Sindiforall,
list.item: is ſaid of thoſe Moods, the fourth terme of whoſe Analogie is onely illatitious to the maine quaeſitum.
list.label: Sindiforation,
list.item: is the affection of thoſe foreſaid Moods, whereby the value of the menſurator is knowne.
list.label: Sindiforatall,
list.item: is concerning thoſe Moods, whoſe illatitious terme is an Angle.
list.label: Sindiforiutall,
list.item: is of thoſe Moods, whoſe illatitious terme is a ſide; all theſe foure words are compoſed of repreſentatives, and (if I remember well) mentioned in my explanation.
list.label: Sinocoſinall,
list.item: is ſaid of the Concordances of thoſe Moods, which agree in this, that their Analogies run upon ſines, and ſine-complements.
list.label: Sinocotangentall,
list.item: is ſaid of thoſe Moods, which agree in that the termes of their Analogie run upon Sines and Tangent-complements.
list.label: Sinus,
list.item: is ſo called (I beleeve) becauſe it is alwayes in the very boſome of the Circle.
list.label: Sinuſed,
list.item: is ſaid of termes endowed or inveſted with Sines.
list.label: Specialized,
list.item: contracted to more particular termes, vide, Individuated.
list.label: Specifying,
list.item: determinating, particulariſing.
list.label: Specification,
list.item: a making more eſpeciall, by contracting the generality of a thing, vide, Specialized.
list.label: Sphericodiſergeticks,
list.item: are the Sphericall Triangles of two operations.
list.label: Structure
list.item: of an operation, is the whole frame thereof, from ſtruo, ſtructum.
list.label: Subdatoquaere,
list.item: is a particular datoquaere, and is applied to the problems of the caſes of every Sphericodiſergetick Mood, vide, Sub-problems.
list.label: Sabajcent,
list.item: is the ſubſterned ſide or the Baſe, of ſub & jaceo, vide, Suſtentative, Suſtaining ſide and Subſterned.
list.label: Subordinate
list.item: problems, is the ſame with ſubdatoquaere.
list.label: Subproblems,
list.item: is the ſame with ſubordinate problems, or problemets.
list.label: Subſervient,
list.item: is ſaid of Moods which ſerve in the operation of other Moods.
list.label: Subſterned,
list.item: is the ſubjacent ſide or Baſe: or, more generally, any ſide oppoſite to an Angle; of ſub and ſterno, ſternere, vide, Subjacent.
list.label: Subtendent,
list.item: is the ſide oppoſite to the right Angle, of ſub and tendo; as if you would ſay, Under-ſtretched.
list.label: Subtendentine,
list.item: is the ſubtendent of a little rectangled Triangle, comprehended within the Area of a great one, and is ſometimes called the little ſubtendent, and reere ſubtendent.
list.label: Subtendent all,
list.item: is the ſubtendent of a great rectangled Triangle, within whoſe capacity is included a little one: it is likewiſe called the great ſubtendent, and maine ſubtendent.
list.label: Supernumerary,
list.item: is ſaid of the digit, by the which the propoſed number exceeds in places the number of the places of the Radius.
list.label: Supplements,
list.item:
are the Oblongs made of the Segments of the root of a Square; and ſo called, becauſe they ſupply all that the Diagonals or
Squares of the Segments joyned together, want of the whole lines ſquare.
list.label: Suppone ſeverally,
list.item: is to ſignifie ſeverall things.
list.label: Suſtaining ſide
list.item: is the ſubſterned, or ſubjacent ſide.
list.label: Suſtentative,
list.item: is the ſame with ſuſtaining, ſubſterned, ſubjacent and Baſe.
list.label: Sympathie
list.item: of Angles, is a ſimilitude in their affection, of 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , paſſio, vide homogeneall.

list.head: T.
list.label: TAble,
list.item: is an Index ſometimes, and ſometimes it is taken for a Briefe and ſummary way of expreſsing many things.
list.label: Tangentine,
list.item: is that which concerneth Tangents or touch-lines.
list.label: Tangentoſinall,
list.item: is ſaid of the Concordance of thoſe Loxogonoſphericals, the termes of whoſe Analogie runne upon Tangents and Sines.
list.label: Tenet,
list.item: is a ſecondary maxim, and is onely ſaid here of Cathetothetick principles.
list.label: Theorematick,
list.item: ſpeculative, from 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , a ſpeculation, which cometh from 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , or 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , ſpeculare, or contemplare.
list.label: Topanglet,
list.item: and verticalin are the ſame.
list.label: Trigonometry,
list.item: is the Art of calculating, and meaſuring of Triangles, of 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , triangulus, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , metior.
list.label: Triſſotetras,
list.item:
is that which runneth all along upon threes and foures of 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , and in plurali,
〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , tertius, trinus, triplex, tres, and 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , numerus quaternarius, from 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , quatuor.

list.head: U.
list.label: VAriator,
list.item: is from vario, variare, to diver ſifie, and is ſaid of caſes, which upon the ſame Datas are onely diverſe in the manner of reſolving the Quaeſitum.
list.label: Verticaline,
list.item: verticall, verticalet, are the top-angles, and top-anglets, from vertex, verticis.
list.label: Underproblem,
list.item: problemet, ſubordinate problem, ſub-problem, under-datoquaere, and ſub▪ datoquaere are, all the ſame thing.
list.label: Unradiated,
list.item: or unradiuſed, is ſaid of a ſumme of Logarithms from which the Radius is abſtracted.

list.head: Z.
list.label: ZEterick,
list.item: is ſaid of Loxogonoſphericall Moods which agree in the ſame quaeſitas, from 〈 in non-Latin alphabet 〉 , quaero, inquiro.

div.head: The finall Concluſion.
div.p: IF the novelty of this my Invention be acceptable (as I doubt not but it will) to the moſt Learned, and judicious Mathematicians, I have already reaped all the benefit I expected by it, and ſhall hereafter, (God willing) without hope of any further recompence, cheerfully under-goe more laborious employments, of the like nature, to doe them ſervice: But as for ſuch, who, either underſtanding it not, or vain-gloriouſly being accuſtomed to Criticiſe on the Works of others, will preſume to carp therein at what they cannot amend, I pray God to illuminate their Judgements, and rectifie their Wils, that they may know more, and cenſure leſſe; for ſo by forbearing detraction, the venom whereof muſt needs reflect upon themſelves, they will come to approve better of the endeavours of thoſe, that wiſh them no harme.

div.head: The Diorthoſis.
div.p: THe miſtakes of the Preſſe, can breed but little obſtruction to the progreſſe of the ingenious Reader, if with his Pen, before he enter upon the peruſall of this Treatiſe, he be pleaſed thus to correct (as I hope he will) theſe enſuing

row.cell: the Schemes & dining room totall ſumme.
as the Sine of the coſubtendent.

div.p: What errors elſe (if any) have ſlipt animadverſion (beſides their not being very materiall) are ſo intelligible, that being by the eaſieſt judgement with as much facility eſchewable, as I can obſerve them, not to mention the commiſſion of ſuch faults is no great omiſſion; and therefore will I heartily (without further ceremony) conduct the Student (who making this the beginning of the Book, as it is moſt fit he doe, ſeeing a Ruler ſhould be made ſtreight before any thing be ruled by it) is willing to go along with me from hence circularly through the title, to the end of the Treatiſe in the propoſed way, as followes.
div.trailer: And ſo God bleſſe us both.
